ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:0.4_0: The third training rule on acknowledgment
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.2_0: At that time in Sāvatthī a certain family had confidence in a certain family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.3_0: They were growing in faith, but declining in wealth. Whatever food they had in the morning, they gave to the monks. Sometimes they went without food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.4_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.5_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics receive without moderation?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.6_0: After giving to them, these people sometimes go without.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.7_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.9_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.10_0: “Monks, if a family’s faith is growing, but its wealth is declining, I allow you to designate it as ‘in training’, through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.11_0: And it is to be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.12_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.13_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.15_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should designate that family as “in training”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.17_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.19_0: The Sangha designates that family as “in training”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.20_0: Any monk who approves of designating that family as “in training” should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.21_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.22_0: The Sangha has designated that family as “in training”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.23_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.24_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.25.1_0: ‘There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.26_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.27_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.1_0: On that occasion they were holding a celebration in Sāvatthī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.2_0: and people invited the monks for a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.3_0: And so did the family that had been designated as in training.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.4_0: But the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.5_0: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from such a family, and being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.6_0: They then complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.7_0: “What is it with us that they don’t receive from us?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.8_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.10_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.11_0: “Monks, if you have been invited, I allow you to eat staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from a family designated as in training.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.12_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.13.1_0: ‘There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk, without first being invited, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.14_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.15_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.1_0: Soon afterwards a certain monk was associating with that family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.2_0: One morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, went to them.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.2_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.3_0: Just then that monk was sick,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.4_0: and so they invited him to eat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.7_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from such a family, and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.8_0: And being unable to walk for alms,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.10_0: After returning to the monastery, he told the monks what had happened,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.11_0: They in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.12_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.13_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to receive staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from a family designated as in training.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.15.1_0: ‘There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk, without being sick and without first being invited, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.16_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.1_0: There are families that are designated as “in training”:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.2_0: a family is designated as “in training”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.2_1: Such a family is designated as “in training” through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.6_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.10_0: invited for later on the same day or for the following day, but they have invited the vicinity of the house.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.11_0: Refuses an offer to eat more:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.12_0: invited for later on the same day or for the following day, but not after entering the vicinity of the house—this is called “invited”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.14_0: who is able to walk for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.16_0: who is unable to walk for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.18_0: apart from the five staple foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “non-staple food”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.20_0: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.21_0: If she is not sick, and she receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.22_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.1_0: If a family is designated as in training, and he perceives it as such, and he, without being sick and without being invited, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from that family, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.2_0: If a family is designated as in training, but he is unsure of it, and he, without being sick and without being invited, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from that family, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.3_0: If a family is designated as in training, but he does not perceive it as such, and he, without being sick and without being invited, eats staple or non-staple food after personally receiving it from that family, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.4_0: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.5_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.6_0: If a family is not designated as in training, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.7_0: If a family is not designated as in training, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.8_0: If a family is not designated as in training, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.2_0: if he has been invited to a meal;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.4_0: if he eats the leftovers from one who has been invited or who is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.5_0: yet some other mendicant prepared alms for them.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.6_0: if they give after coming out from the house;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.8_0: * The meal offerings that are drawn,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.9_0: if it is cooked with rice;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.10_0: if it is on the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.11_0: if it is on the day after the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.12_0: if the family gives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics, saying, “When there’s a reason, make use of these;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.15_0: The third training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
